paragraphs.zh-tw: I just want to say my name is Emmanuel Jal. And I come from a long way. I've been telling a story that has been so painful for me.
paragraphs.en: 我叫做Emmanuel Jal 我經歷過許多事 長期以來，我向大眾述說那些痛苦的往事

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's been a tough journey for me, traveling the world, telling my story in form of a book. And also telling it like now.
paragraphs.en: 對我來說，這是個辛苦的過程，我拜訪各國演說 將我的故事撰寫成書 也像現在這樣演講

paragraphs.zh-tw: And also, the easiest one was when I was doing it in form of a music. So I have branded myself as a war child.
paragraphs.en: 還有，最輕鬆的方式是 透過音樂來傳達我的想法 我替自己取了個綽號，叫做戰地兒童

paragraphs.zh-tw: I'm doing this because of an old lady in my village now, who have lost her children. There is no newspaper to cover her pain, and what she wants to change in this society.
paragraphs.en: 我這麼做 是因為和我同個村莊的老婦人 失去了她的孩子 沒有新聞願意報導她的苦痛 以及她想為社會做的改變

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I'm doing it for a young man who want to create a change and has no way to project his voice because he can't write. Or there is no Internet, like Facebook, MySpace, YouTube, for them to talk.
paragraphs.en: 我這麼做，也是為了一個年輕人 他想要改變，卻無處發聲 因為他不會寫字 也沒有網路，沒有Facebook、Myspace 或是YouTube等平台讓他們發聲

paragraphs.zh-tw: Also one thing that kept me pushing this story, this painful stories out, the dreams I have, sometimes, is like the voices of the dead, that I have seen would tell me, "Don't give up. Keep on going." Because sometime I feel like stopping and not doing it, because I didn't know what I was putting myself into. Well I was born in the most difficult time, when my country was at war.
paragraphs.en: 另一個無形鞭策我這麼努力地說故事 四處分享這痛苦歷程的動力，就是我的夢想 有時候就像是，我會聽到 那些不幸喪命的人的聲音 告訴我，「別放棄，堅持下去」 因為我曾經幾度想放棄 我不曉得這麼做會把自己推向什麼境地 我出生時，正好是生活最艱困的時刻 我的國家承受戰火摧殘

paragraphs.zh-tw: I saw my village burned down. The world that meant a lot to me, I saw it vanish in my face.
paragraphs.en: 我看著我的村莊被燒毀 這個對我意義非凡的世界， 從我眼前消失

paragraphs.zh-tw: I saw my aunt in rape when I was only five. My mother was claimed by the war.
paragraphs.en: 我五歲時，看到我阿姨被強姦 母親死於戰爭

paragraphs.zh-tw: My brothers and sisters were scattered. And up to now, me and my father were detached and I still have issues with him.
paragraphs.en: 我的兄弟姐妹們四散各處 到現在，即使我和我的父親已不在一起 我對他還是心懷芥蒂

paragraphs.zh-tw: Seeing people die every day, my mother crying, it's like I was raised in a violence. And that made me call myself a war child.
paragraphs.en: 我每天目睹死亡 看著母親哭泣 就像是被暴戾之氣扶養帶大一樣 所以我自稱戰地兒童

paragraphs.zh-tw: And not only that, when I was eight I became a child soldier. I didn't know what was the war for.
paragraphs.en: 不只如此，在我八歲時 我成了童兵 我不知道打仗是為了什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: But one thing I knew was an image that I saw that stuck in my head. When I went to the training camp I say, "I want to kill as many Muslims, and as many Arabs, as possible." The training wasn't easy, but that was the driving force, because I wanted to revenge for my family.
paragraphs.en: 我只知道 那些在我腦中、揮之不去的畫面 當我到了童兵訓練營，我說 我想要儘可能 殺光所有的回教徒和阿拉伯人 裡面的訓練很辛苦，但那是我支撐下去的動力 因為我想替家人復仇

paragraphs.zh-tw: I wanted to revenge for my village. Luckily now things have changed because I came to discover the truth.
paragraphs.en: 我想為村民復仇 幸運地，現在一切有了轉機 因為我發現了事實

paragraphs.zh-tw: What was actually killing us wasn't the Muslims, wasn't the Arabs. It was somebody sitting somewhere manipulating the system, and using religion to get what they want to get out of us, which is the oil, the diamond, the gold and the land.
paragraphs.en: 殺我們的並不是回教徒 不是阿拉伯人 而是某些藏在暗處、操縱我們的人 他們利用我們的信仰，獲得他想要的 也就是石油、鑽石 黃金和土地

paragraphs.zh-tw: So realizing the truth gave me a position to choose: should I continue to hate, or let it go? So I happened to forgive. Now I sing music with the Muslims. I dance with them. I even had a movie out called "War Child," funded by Muslim people.
paragraphs.en: 理解到這個事實，讓我有能力選擇 我該繼續憤怒，還是放下？ 而我選擇原諒。現在我和回教徒 一起高歌、一塊跳舞 我甚至還拍了一部由回教徒贊助的電影 叫做「戰地兒童」

paragraphs.zh-tw: So that pain has gone out. But my story is huge.
paragraphs.en: 痛苦已漸漸離去 但我的故事是很龐雜的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I'm just going to go into a different step now, which is easier for me. I'm going to give you poem called "Forced to Sin," which is from my album "War Child." I talk about my story.
paragraphs.en: 所以現在，我要用一個不同的作法 一個對我來說簡單一點的方式 我想朗誦一首詩 叫做「被迫犯罪」 選自我的專輯《戰地兒童》 它在說我的故事

paragraphs.zh-tw: One of the journey that I tread when I was tempted to eat my friend because we had no food and we were like around 400. And only 16 people survived that journey.
paragraphs.en: 在一次行軍 因為沒有食物，我必須吃下同伴的屍體果腹 一開始我們的隊伍有400人 行軍最後，只剩下16人還活著

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I hope you're going to hear this. My dreams are like torment.
paragraphs.en: 我希望，你們能聽見我的聲音 我在夢中反覆煎熬

paragraphs.zh-tw: My every moment. Voices in my brain, of friends that was slain.
paragraphs.en: 每一刻 腦中都傳來死去朋友的聲音

paragraphs.zh-tw: Friends like Lual who died by my side, of starvation. In the burning jungle, and the desert plain.
paragraphs.en: 他們就像Lual這樣，再也無法承受飢餓 死在我身旁 在烈火焚林，也在廣漠荒原

paragraphs.zh-tw: Next was I, but Jesus heard my cry. As I was tempted to eat the rotten flesh of my comrade, he gave me comfort.
paragraphs.en: 下一個應該就輪到我，但耶穌聽見了我的哭喊 就當我要吃下同伴的 腐爛身軀時 祂給我慰藉

paragraphs.zh-tw: We used to raid villages, stealing chickens, goats and sheeps, anything we could eat. I knew it was rude, but we needed food.
paragraphs.en: 我們曾掠奪村莊 偷走雞隻和羊群 偷走所有能吃的東西 我明白這很粗蠻，但我們需要食物

paragraphs.zh-tw: And therefore I was forced to sin, forced to sin to make a living, forced to sin to make a living. Sometimes you gotta lose to win.
paragraphs.en: 所以我不得不犯罪 為了生存，我被迫去犯罪 為了生存，我被迫去犯罪 有時候，你必須有失，才能有得

paragraphs.zh-tw: Never give up. Never give in. Left home at the age of seven.
paragraphs.en: 別放棄，別投降 七歲離家

paragraphs.zh-tw: One year later, live with an AK-47 by my side. Slept with one eye open wide.
paragraphs.en: 一年後，身邊多了把AK-47步槍 睡覺還得睜著一隻眼

paragraphs.zh-tw: Run, duck, play dead and hide. I've seen my people die like flies.
paragraphs.en: 奔跑、閃避、裝死、躲藏 同伴們彷彿螻蟻般一個個死去

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I've never seen a dead body, at least one that I've killed. But still as I wonder, I won't go under.
paragraphs.en: 但我從沒見過任何一具屍體 至少沒見過因我而死的屍體 但每當我徘徊，仍不認輸

paragraphs.zh-tw: Guns barking like lightning and thunder. As a child so young and tender, Words I can't forget I still remember.
paragraphs.en: 四處都是槍林彈雨 當時還年幼脆弱的我 無法忘卻那個人說的話

paragraphs.zh-tw: I saw sergeant command raising his hand, no retreat, no surrender. I carry the banner of the trauma.
paragraphs.en: 我看見那個指揮官高舉雙手喊 「不撤退，不投降」 我遍體鱗傷

paragraphs.zh-tw: War child, child without a mama, still fighting in the saga. Yet as I wage this new war I'm not alone in this drama.
paragraphs.en: 戰地兒童，沒有母親的孩子 仍上演著拚鬥的冒險故事 然而在這場嶄新的戰役中，我並不孤單

paragraphs.zh-tw: No sit or stop, as I reach for the top I'm fully dedicated like a patriotic cop. I'm on a fight, day and night.
paragraphs.en: 不到終點決不休息 像個愛國的警察般全力以赴 不分日夜地奮鬥

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sometime I do wrong in order to make things right. It's like I'm living a dream.
paragraphs.en: 有時犯錯，是為了成就對的事 彷彿一直以來，我都活在夢中

paragraphs.zh-tw: First time I'm feeling like a human being. Ah! The children of Darfur.
paragraphs.en: 直到現在，才頭一次感覺自己像個人 阿！達佛的孩子

paragraphs.zh-tw: Your empty bellies on the telly and now it's you that I'm fighting for. Left home.
paragraphs.en: 電視中你飢餓的肚皮 正是我奮鬥的原因 離開家園

paragraphs.zh-tw: Don't even know the day I'll ever return. My country is war-torn.
paragraphs.en: 不曉得何時才能回家 我的家園被戰爭摧毀

paragraphs.zh-tw: Music I used to hear was bombs and fire of guns. So many people die that I don't even cry no more.
paragraphs.en: 陪伴我的音樂，是隆隆作響的炸彈和槍聲 太多人死亡，我甚至再也流不出淚

paragraphs.zh-tw: Ask God question, what am I here for. And why are my people poor.
paragraphs.en: 請問蒼天，我的存在有意義嗎 為什麼我們如此窮困

paragraphs.zh-tw: And why, why when the rest of the children were learning how to read and write, I was learning how to fight. I ate snails, vultures, rabbits, snakes, and anything that had life.
paragraphs.en: 為什麼當其他孩子在上學時 我卻學習如何打仗 我吃過蝸牛、禿鷹、兔子、蛇 任何有生命的東西

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was ready to eat. I know it's a shame. But who is to be blamed? That's my story shared in the form of a lesson.
paragraphs.en: 我都吃過 我知道很丟臉，但我能怪誰？ 這就是我的故事 (鼓掌)

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you. What energized me and kept me going is the music I do.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝 (鼓掌) 我的音樂是支持我繼續的力量

paragraphs.zh-tw: I never saw anybody to tell my story to them so they could advise me or do therapy. So the music had been my therapy for me.
paragraphs.en: 沒人能替我 向大眾訴說我的故事 找人來輔導我、安慰我 所以音樂成了我療傷的藥方

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's been where I actually see heaven, where I can be happy, where I can be a child again, in dances, through music. So one thing I know about music: music is the only thing that has power to enter your cell system, your mind, your heart, influence your soul and your spirit, and can even influence the way you live without even you knowing.
paragraphs.en: 在音樂裡，我看見天堂 在那裡，我能感受快樂 我能找回童真，自在跳舞 我知道 世上只有音樂能有力量 穿越你的肌膚 你的意志、你的心靈 影響你的靈魂 並且在不知不覺中 影響你的生活方式

paragraphs.zh-tw: Music is the only thing that can make you want to wake up your bed and shake your leg, without even wanting to do it. And so the power music has I normally compare to the power love when love doesn't see a color.
paragraphs.en: 只有音樂，才能讓你 早上自然地從床上醒來 不假思索地 踢踢雙腳 我常拿音樂的力量 和愛的力量相提並論 愛是不分種族膚色的

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know, if you fall in love with a frog, that's it. One testimony about how I find music is powerful is when I was still a soldier back then.
paragraphs.en: 就像你愛上了青蛙，也就只能愛上了 關於我發現音樂強大力量 的另一則故事 是發生在我還是童兵的時候

paragraphs.zh-tw: I hated the people in the north. But I don't know why I don't hate their music.
paragraphs.en: 當時我痛恨北方的人 但我就是不恨他們的音樂

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we party and dance to their music. And one thing that shocked me is one day they brought an Arab musician to come and entertain the soldiers.
paragraphs.en: 我們總能隨他們的音樂起舞狂歡 最讓我吃驚的是 有天，一個阿拉伯音樂家 來營裡為士兵們表演

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I almost broke my leg dancing to his music. But I had this question.
paragraphs.en: 那次我跳舞跳到腳都快斷了 所以我有了個疑問

paragraphs.zh-tw: So now I'm doing music so I know what the power of music is. So what's happening here? I've been in a painful journey.
paragraphs.en: 我現在成了音樂人，也懂得了音樂的力量 從以前的我到現在，這中間發生了什麼事？ 最近我正在進行一項痛苦的修煉

paragraphs.zh-tw: Today is day number 233 in which I only eat dinner. I don't eat breakfast. No lunch.
paragraphs.en: 這段時間我只吃晚餐 到今天是第233天 沒有早餐、沒有午餐

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I've done a campaign called Lose to Win. Where I'm losing so that I could win the battle that I'm fighting now.
paragraphs.en: 我發起一個運動叫做 「先有失，才有得」 像我現在做的事 我放棄了一些東西來贏得勝利

paragraphs.zh-tw: So my breakfast, my lunch, I donate it to a charity that I founded because we want to build a school in Sudan. And I'm doing this because also it's a normal thing in my home, people eat one meal a day.
paragraphs.en: 我的早餐、午餐 都捐給我成立的慈善機構 因為我想為蘇丹的孩子蓋間學校 另一方面，我這麼做也是因為 在我的國家，一天吃一餐是很正常的

paragraphs.zh-tw: Here I am in the West. I choose not to. So in my village now, kids there, they normally listen to BBC, or any radio, and they are waiting to know, the day Emmanuel will eat his breakfast it means he got the money to build our school.
paragraphs.en: 現在我到了西方國家，我仍選擇只吃一餐 在我家鄉的孩子們 會聽著BBC或其他廣播 等著想知道 何時Emmanuel會重新開始吃早餐 因為，那就表示有錢蓋學校了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And so I made a commitment. I say, "I'm gonna not eat my breakfast." I thought I was famous enough that I would raise the money within one month, but I've been humbled. So it's taken me 232 days.
paragraphs.en: 所以我做了承諾，我說 「我決定不要吃早餐」 我以為依照我的名氣，一個月內應該就能達成目標 後來發現是我想太多了 所以我花了232天

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I said, "No stop until we get it." And like it's been done on Facebook, MySpace. The people are giving three dollars.
paragraphs.en: 而我還是說，「未達目的決不放棄」 在Facebook和Myspace都有人響應我的行動 有人捐出三塊美金

paragraphs.zh-tw: The lowest amount we ever got was 20 cents. Somebody donated 20 cents online.
paragraphs.en: 我們也曾獲得最低的捐贈，美金20分 對方透過網路捐了美金20分

paragraphs.zh-tw: I don't know how they did it. But that moved me.
paragraphs.en: 我真不曉得他們怎麼做到的 但他們的善心感動了我

paragraphs.zh-tw: And so, the importance of education to me is what I'm willing to die for. I'm willing to die for this, because I know what it can do to my people.
paragraphs.en: 對我而言，教育 是值得用生命換取的 我願意誓死奉獻 因為我知道這能為我的族人做什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: Education enlighten your brain, give you so many chances, and you're able to survive. As a nation we have been crippled.
paragraphs.en: 教育啟發心智 賦予我們選擇的權利 讓我們有生存的機會 那是個羸弱不堪的國度

paragraphs.zh-tw: For so many years we have fed on aid. You see a 20-years-old, 30-years-old families in a refugee camps.
paragraphs.en: 多年來只能靠援助維生 你可以看到2、30歲的人 與家人同住在難民營

paragraphs.zh-tw: They only get the food that drops from the sky, from the U.N. So these people, you're killing a whole generation if you just give them aid.
paragraphs.en: 他們只能得到聯合國空投下來的食物 這些人 如果只給予他們救濟物資的話，就形同扼殺了整個世代

paragraphs.zh-tw: If anybody want to help us this is what we need. Give us tools. Give the farmers tools.
paragraphs.en: 如果有任何人想幫助我們 請先了解我們的需要 請給我們工具，給我們農具

paragraphs.zh-tw: It's rain. Africa is fertile. They can grow the crops. Invest in education.
paragraphs.en: 非洲有雨水、有沃土，人們是可以耕作的 請投資教育吧

paragraphs.zh-tw: Education so that we have strong institution that can create a revolution to change everything. Because we have all those old men that are creating wars in Africa. They will die soon.
paragraphs.en: 投資教育，我們才能有健全的組織 足以發起革新，改變原有的一切 那些在非洲製造戰爭的老頭們 垂垂老矣，很快就會死了

paragraphs.zh-tw: But if you invest in education then we'll be able to change Africa. That's what I'm asking.
paragraphs.en: 如果你們投資教育 我們就能改造非洲 這就是我所呼籲的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So in order to do that, I founded a charter called Gua Africa, where we put kids in school. And now we have a couple in university.
paragraphs.en: 為了這個目標 我創立了Gua Africa機構 安置孩子上學 而現在幾個孩子已上了大學

paragraphs.zh-tw: We have like 40 kids, ex-child soldiers mixed with anybody that we feel like we want to support. And I said "I'm going to put it in practice." And with the people that are going to follow me and help me do things.
paragraphs.en: 我們有40幾個孩子，他們有些曾是童兵 還有一些我們認為同樣需要支援的孩子 我說，我們要付諸實踐 和那些願意跟隨我、幫助我的人

paragraphs.zh-tw: That's what I want to do to change, to make a difference in the world. Well now, my time is going, so I want to sing a song.
paragraphs.en: 我們想要做出改變 創造不同的世界 現在，時間不多了 我想唱首歌

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I'll ask you guys to stand up so we celebrate the life of a British aid worker called Emma McCune that made it possible for me to be here. I'm gonna sing this song, just to inspire you how this woman has made a difference.
paragraphs.en: 請大家站起來 讓我們來讚頌一位英國的救助人員 她叫做Emma McCune 因為她，我才能站在這 我要唱這首歌 邀你們一同感受這位女子如何發揮影響

paragraphs.zh-tw: She came to my country and saw the importance of education. She said the only way to help Sudan is to invest in the women, educating them, educating the children, so that they could come and create a revolution in this complex society.
paragraphs.en: 她來到我的國家 看見教育的重要性 她說幫助蘇丹唯一的方法 就是投資在教育女人 教育小孩上 他們才有辦法在這複雜的環境中 做出改變

paragraphs.zh-tw: So she even ended up marrying a commander from the SPLA. And she rescued over 150 child soldiers.
paragraphs.en: 她甚至後來選擇嫁給蘇丹人民解放軍的 指揮官 她拯救了超過150個童兵

paragraphs.zh-tw: One of them happened to be me now. And so at this moment I want to ask to celebrate Emma with me.
paragraphs.en: 其中一個就是我 所以現在我想邀請大家跟我一起讚頌Emma

paragraphs.zh-tw: Are you guys ready to celebrate Emma? Audience: Yes!
